title: The Hela cell strain: cervical carcinoma
brief_description: Part of the Living Human Cells in Culture series. The film is introduced with a sequence of tissue preparation for photography, and then shows the physiological characteristics of Hela cells, a malignant strain of cervical origin. Among the processes shown are cell drinking, nuclear rotation, mitosis and the action of filapodia in intercellular communications.
